hopobject.name: CapeContest
hopobject.http_browser: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0)
hopobject.body:
Make the BeagleBone fly to new heights.

Announcing the BeagleBone Cape Plug-in Board Design Contest. Do you have a great idea for a new BeagleBone Cape? Submit your design for the chance to have your cape created and sold. Your friends will be envious of you, your children will admire you and you'll be the rock star of the Beagle community! Plus, you get a cut of the profits!

Read the important info below and click on this huge button when you are ready to enter. Good luck!

How to Enter

  1. Come up with an original cape design. Minimum requirements:
    • Schematic layout (including reference designators and an extractable net-list)
    • Bill of Materials not to exceed $60 (in Excel format; noting reference designators and manufacturer part numbers)
  2. Upload your project to an online file sharing site (ex: Google Drive, Github) and make sure you set it for public view.
  3. Record a video describing your cape idea and upload it to YouTube. Get creative!
  4. Click on the ridiculously big Submit Design Here button above to submit your BeagleBone Cape Design Contest entry.

Key Dates

  • Submission: November 1 - December 31, 2012 11:59:59 PM PST
  • Judging: January 7 – 11, 2013
  • Winners announced: January 14, 2013

Judging/Voting

  1. On January 7, 2013, a completed entries page will go live listing all the submitted entries that meet the minimum requirements.
  2. A judging panel led by legendary Jason Kridner, the father of Beagle, Gerald Coley and others from TI and CircuitCo will decide the three cape winners.
  3. All of cyberspace will have the opportunity to influence the judges by using Google + and Facebook Likes.
  4. During the judging phase you can see in real-time how many people support your design.
  5. So get everyone you know to + and Like your design!

 

Prizes

Grand Prize:

The top three (3) winning designs will:

  • Have their design manufactured and sold through CircuitCo Electronics
  • Get $500 from Texas Instruments
  • Get $500 from Mouser
  • Receive their choice of one of the following tools from Total Phase:
    • Beagle USB 480 Protocol Analyzer
    • I2C/SPI Kit
    • CAN/I2C Kit

Weekly Prizes:

A weekly contest will be posted on this contest page. The winner will be randomly selected from all correct current entries and will receive one of the following prizes:
  • Tools from Total Phase
  • ProtoCapes from AdaFruit
  • MetaWatches from Mouser

Sponsors

Contest Guidelines

  • You must be 18 years or older.
  • Entries must have a minimum of a schematic capture and bill of materials hosted on file sharing site (ex: Google Drive, Github).
  • The BOM cost cannot exceed $60.
  • A video of your design uploaded to YouTube.
  • Entries remain the property of the submitter with rights to manufacture and sell granted to CircuitCo.
  • Sponsor employees and immediate family are not eligible.
  • Winners will be notified by email of their winning entry.
  • The top three winners will be announced on BeagleBoard.org and through other media outlets.
  • Teams can enter, but each team should designate only one representative per entry who receives that prize should that team win.

BeagleBone Cape Contest Resources

  • BeagleBone Cape Contest Official Rules
  • BeagleBone Capes
  • Ideal Entry
